oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Western & Atlantic Railroad 25 cent train note
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This 25 cent train note was issued by the Western & Atlantic Railroad. Due to the shortage of coins and currency in the 19th century, many businesses and banks issued their own currency. The Western & Atlantic Railroad owned the famous "General." The rail line was vital to the Confederacy as it connected Atlanta with Chattanooga.
